member.summary: Refresh every n seconds (specified in refreshInterval).

member.name: F:FC.GEPluginCtrls.RefreshMode.Expire
member.summary: Refresh when the expiration time is reached. If a fetched file has a NetworkLinkControl, the expires time takes precedence over expiration times specified in HTTP headers. If no expires time is specified, the HTTP max-age header is used (if present). If max-age is not present, the Expires HTTP header is used (if present).

member.summary: No style (none)

member.summary: The feature's visibility is tied to its list item's checkbox state.

member.name: F:FC.GEPluginCtrls.ListItemStyle.CheckOffOnly
member.summary: When specified for a folder, document or network link, prevents all items from being made visible at once. That is, the user can turn all children off but cannot turn them all on at the same time. This setting is useful for containers or network links containing large amounts of data.

member.name: F:FC.GEPluginCtrls.ListItemStyle.CheckHideChildren
member.summary: Use a normal checkbox for visibility but do not display children in a list view. The item's checkbox should allows the user to toggle visibility of the child objects in the viewport.

member.name: F:FC.GEPluginCtrls.ListItemStyle.RadioFolder
member.summary: When specified for a container (a folder or a document), only one of the container's items should be visible at a time. *not yet supported in KmlTreeView*

member.summary:
Wrapper for the KmlColor object, maps all the getter and setter methods to managed properties.
The range of values for any one colour component is 0 to 255 (0x00 to 0xff). For alpha, 0x00 is fully transparent and 0xff is fully opaque.

member.name: T:FC.GEPluginCtrls.AltitudeMode
member.summary: Enumeration of the available altitude modes for the plug-in.

member.name: F:FC.GEPluginCtrls.AltitudeMode.ClampToGround
member.summary: Specifies that altitudes are at ground level. For Ground overlays, this means that the image will be draped over the terrain.

member.name: F:FC.GEPluginCtrls.AltitudeMode.RelativeToGround
member.summary: Specifies that altitudes are to be interpreted as meters above or below ground level. (i.e. the elevation of the terrain at the location).

member.name: F:FC.GEPluginCtrls.AltitudeMode.Absolute
member.summary: Specifies that altitudes are to be interpreted as meters above or below sea level, regardless of the actual elevation of the terrain beneath the object. For example, if you set the altitude of an object to 10 meters with an absolute altitude mode, the object will appear to be at ground level if the terrain beneath is also 10 meters above sea level. If the terrain is 3 meters above sea level, the object will appear elevated above the terrain by 7 meters. If, on the other hand, the terrain is 15 meters above sea level, the object may be completely invisible.

member.name: F:FC.GEPluginCtrls.AltitudeMode.ClampToSeaFloor
member.summary: Specifies that altitudes are at sea floor level.

member.name: F:FC.GEPluginCtrls.AltitudeMode.RelativeToSeafloor
member.summary: Specifies that altitudes are to be interpreted as meters above seafloor. (i.e. the elevation of the seafloor at the location).

member.summary: The plugin object

member.summary: The options object

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GEOptions class.

member.name: M:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.SetMapType(FC.GEPluginCtrls.MapType)
member.summary: Sets the map type to Earth or sky mode.
member.param: The maptype to use in the plugin

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.AtmosphereVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to show the blue atmosphere that appears around the perimeter of the Earth On by default.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.AutoGroundLevelViewEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether automatic ground level view is enabled. When enabled, the view will change to 'ground level view' when the camera reaches ground level. This view provides pan and lookAt controls, but no zoom slider. The tilt will be set to 90, or parallel with level ground.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.BuildingHighlightingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether building highlighting is enabled. When enabled, buildings will be highlighted when they are moused over. Disabled by default

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.BuildingSelectionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether building selection is enabled. If enabled, clicking a building will pop a feature balloon containing information from the Google 3D Warehouse database.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.FadeInOutEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether animation of a features when added/removed from the plugin is enabled The animation consists of a slight change of scale. Default is true.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.FlyToSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the speed at which the camera moves (0 to 5.0). Set to SPEED_TELEPORT to immediately appear at selected destination.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.GridVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid is visible. Disabled by default.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.MouseNavigationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether user mouse control is enabled. Enabled by default. Note: This also enables and disables keyboard navigation (arrow keys, page-up/page-down, etc).

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.OverviewMapVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the overview map is visible. Disabled by default.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.ScaleLegendVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the scale legend is visible. Disabled by default.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.ScrollWheelZoomSpeed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the speed of zoom when user rolls the mouse wheel. Default is 1. Set to a negative number to reverse the zoom direction.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.StatusBarVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the status bar is visible. Disabled by default.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.TerrainExaggeration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the terrain exaggeration value. Valid values are in the range of 1.0 through 3.0. Attempting to set outside of this range will result in the value being clamped.

member.name: P:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEOptions.UnitsFeetMiles
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display units in imperial (feet and miles) or metric (meters and kilometres). A value of true uses imperial, false metric. This setting affects only the values displayed in the status bar and the scale bar. The values passed and returned with an object's properties are always metric. Default value is false (metric)

member.name: T:FC.GEPluginCtrls.ViewerOptions
member.summary: Controls the display of sunlight, historical imagery, and Street View panoramas in the plug-in.

remarks.para: Unlike kmlViewerOptions in the api this class automatically applies any changes when SetOption is called. This negates the user having to create a camera, set its options, then apply its view to the current abstract view to see the change.

member.name: T:FC.GEPluginCtrls.KmlTreeView
member.summary: The KmlTreeView provides a quick and easy way to display kml content. It intergratres with the allowing a user to easily 'fly-to' and toggle the visiblity of features in the plugin.
member.remarks: The control supports virtual loading of content using the class. The KmlTreeView makes use of stacks and background workers to keep the control fast and responsive when dealing with large numbers of nodes. The control also supports tri-view checkboxes to show partial selection within a container.

member.name: T:FC.GEPluginCtrls.GEHelpers
member.summary: This class provides some basic Google Earth plugin helpers functions. Interfaces whose names begin with GE allow for programmatic access to core plugin functionality and other miscellaneous options. It is based on the "GEHelpers javasctipt library" by Roman Nurik See: http://earth-api-samples.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/lib/geplugin-helpers.js
